moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 b6 3. Nf3 h6: Too many pawn moves, neglecting development.
moves.4. Bd3 Bb7 5. O-O g6 6. Re1 Bg7 7. Nc3: Better was 7. c3. The knight is not strongly posted here because Black controls d5.
moves.7... a6 8. e5: Eyeballing the g6 square, with ideas of sacrifice.
moves.8... d6 9. Bf4: Capturing the pawn would help Black to develop with 9...Qxd6.
moves.9... g5: Natural, but it weakens f5 slightly. This will turn out to be fatal.
moves.10. Bg3 d5 11. Ne2: Admitting that the knight needs a better square, somewhere.
moves.12. Qd2: 12. c3 was still better. The idea was to attack the g5 pawn with thoughts of a sacrificial attack, but it is unsound.
moves.12... Nf5: Black now has a decent position, except for his pawn structure.
moves.13. c3 Nc6 14. Qc2: Intending to force Black's hand. He should now play 14...Nxg6 and hope for the best after 15. Nxg6, Qd7, 16. Nh5.
moves.14... h5: This is a great idea, but it's too slow. White now wins a pawn and gains an attack.
moves.17. Ng5 O-O: Into mate. But he was still lost after 17...Qd7, 18. e6!, or 17...Qe7, 18. Bh4.
